name: Patchouli in Calligraphy Inspired, Shea Butter and Glycerin Soap with Free Shipping in the US
description:
This particular blend of Patchouli has the woody aroma of pungent patchouli leaves with a sophisticated musk background, and it is quite engaging. Patchouli is thought to relieve anxiety, insomnia, and to be an aphrodisiac. While it was the delight of the Love Children of the Sixties, it is experiencing a resurgence among people much younger than hippies, thank goodness.

Now lets talk about the design and colors: This design is inspired by Japanese calligraphy, and uses an earthy mellowed orange, the pure White of the Shea Butter, and a bit of Black pigment for the accent stroke. As you use the bar, its appearance will change, because Mamoucha does not like boredom, and does not know how to do simple anymore.

Mamoucha Soaps use no animal ingredients or testing, but are Vegan, Skin Safe, and use Cruelty Free Fragrances. They are naturally Gluten Free. If you want to gift someone, let me know, and I will include a note from you. The listing is for one 4.5 to 5 oz bar. Nice and big.

description:
Cast in kind to your skin Shea Butter and Glycerin soap, here is Sage and Cinnamon combined with notes of Clove and Nutmeg. It may sound a little different, and it is. The Sage calms down the other spices, and the other spices jazz up the Sage. Together it is heady, rich, toasty, and somehow masculine rather than kitchen like.

Now lets talk about the design and colors: This design is inspired by Japanese calligraphy, and uses many of my favorite micas to color the bars. (Mica is a mineral, which when finely ground like this, shimmers and used in eyeshadow.) I used Really Red,  and Clear Green micas, and a bit of Black pigment for the accent stroke. Then I backed it all up with White Shea Butter. It’s downright handsome.

Mamoucha Soaps use no animal ingredients or testing, but are Vegan, Skin Safe, and use Cruelty Free Fragrances. They are naturally Gluten Free. If you want to gift someone, let me know, and I will include a note from you. The listing is for one 4.5 to 5 oz bar. Nice and big.

name: Absinthe Scented Glycerin Soap in Green, White, and Gold with Free Shipping in the US
description:
Absinthe AKA “The Green Fairy” was once banned around the world because it was portrayed as a dangerously addictive psychoactive drug that produced hallucinations, but this vilification of the liquor was never verified.  The ban on absinthe was lifted in the USA in 2007, and the sales of absinthe liquors have skyrocketed since that time.  This Absinthe fragrance is an aromatic blend of star anise, fennel, spicy cinnamon cassia, nutmeg, melissa, fresh green herbal notes, with base notes of amber and woods. With all that blending, doesn’t smell a bit like licorice, but is wonderfully mysterious.  

Cast in Glycerin, this soap is luxuriously kind to your skin. Colored with Micas, (a finely ground mineral which they use to make eyeshadow shimmer), these Green, White and Golden bars are modern, abstract, and good looking.
